trigonometric function: A function of an angle expressed as a ratio of the length of the sides of a right-angled triangle
inverse function: A function obtained by expressing the dependent variable of one function as the independent variable of another
arctangent: The inverse function of the tangent
arcsine: The inverse function of the sine
cosecant: The reciprocal of the sine function, defined as the ratio of the hypotenuse to the opposite side of a right-angled triangle
cotangent: The reciprocal of the tangent function, defined as the ratio of the adjacent to the opposite side of a right-angled triangle
trigonometric identity: An equality involving trigonometric functions that is true for all values of the variables
law of sines: In a triangle, the ratio of the length of a side to the sine of its opposite angle is constant
law of cosines: In a triangle, the square of a side is equal to the sum of the squares of the other two sides minus twice the product of these two sides and the cosine of the included angle
radian measure: The measure of an angle in radians, which is the ratio of the length of an arc to its radius
angular velocity: The rate of change of an angle with respect to time
arc length: The distance between two points along a section of a curve
sector: The portion of a circle enclosed by two radii and their intercepted arc
trigonometric ratio: The ratio of the lengths of two sides of a right triangle
trigonometric equation: An equation involving one or several trigonometric functions of a variable
